comment.author: 27398485@N08
comment._content: www.adb.online.anu.edu.au/biogs/A010120b.htm A Memorial statue monument, with cannon, of Governor Sir Richard Bourke ( 1877 - 1855) near Public Library of New South Wales in the Domain reserve set up in 1788. Commissioned around 1837, when Bourke left the island.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Photo c.1890 (like a lot of Henry King's photos) due to the background building being demolished for the 1891 Australian Club.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: The cannon were moved to Centennial Park in 1925 - trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/16383866 [http://www.flickr.com/photos/centennialparklands/4167945096/]

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Of course! I used to live near Centennial Park back in the mid 1970s and spent hours wandering around the place at all times of day and night (when it was closed and supposedly a dangerous place to be). I didn't make the cannon connection though!
